article_title: Audi to Build Electric Cars Geared to Chinese Buyers From 2024
article_text: LISTEN TO ARTICLE    1:41      SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"QI4VKYDWRGGE01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2020-10-13/audi-to-build-electric-cars-geared-to-chinese-buyers-from-2024"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-sTDuQ3K"}       A visitor looks at an Audi e-trion car at the Beijing Auto Show in Beijing on Sept. 27.   Photographer: Wang Zhao/AFP via Getty Images      Photographer: Wang Zhao/AFP via Getty Images    Volkswagen AG’s Audi is expanding its partnership with Chinese manufacturer FAW as the German premium brand seeks to build more battery-powered cars geared to customers in its largest market.    Audi and FAW on Tuesday signed a memorandum of understanding to start a company that will produce electric cars for the Chinese market from 2024, Audi said in a statement. The new cars will be designed to meet the requirements of local premium buyers and use the PPE electric platform developed with Porsche, Audi said.    {"contentId":"QI4VKYDWRGGE01","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[1,8]],"small_desktop":[[1,8]],"tablet":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2020-10-13/audi-to-build-electric-cars-geared-to-chinese-buyers-from-2024"},"containerId":"outstream-video-1-QI4VKYDWRGGE01"}   {"contentId":"QI4VKYDWRGGE01","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"mobile":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2020-10-13/audi-to-build-electric-cars-geared-to-chinese-buyers-from-2024"},"containerId":"outstream-video-2-QI4VKYDWRGGE01"}   “This decision emphasizes the strategic importance of the Chinese market,” Chief Executive Officer Markus Duesmann said. The companies signed the agreement during a German-Chinese car conference in Changchun.    {"contentId":"QI4VKYDWRGGE01","position":"box","dimensions":{"mobile":[[300,250],[3,3],[1,1],"fluid"]},"type":"Mobile Body Box Ad","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"box1","positionIncrement":1,"url":"/news/articles/2020-10-13/audi-to-build-electric-cars-geared-to-chinese-buyers-from-2024"},"containerId":"box-MZlTE0P"}   After entering the country in the late 1980s with FAW and building an early lead, Audi sales rose and the brand became the quasi-official ride of high-ranking government officials and privileged businessmen. Yet in recent years, Audi has seen rising competition from Daimler AG’s Mercedes-Benz and BMW AG, which have won over buyers with new designs.    China’s government has poured upwards of $30 billion into nurturing its electric-vehicle industry, building the world’s largest market for battery-powered cars. Higher subsidies in several countries in Europe have spurred sales there, meaning the region looks increasingly likely to outpace China soon, according to a report by research firm Jato Dynamics.  {"contentId":"QI4VKYDWRGGE01","position":"desktop-in-article1","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[5,4]],"small_desktop":[[5,4]]},"type":"Desktop in article Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"desktop-in-article1","url":"/news/articles/2020-10-13/audi-to-build-electric-cars-geared-to-chinese-buyers-from-2024"},"containerId":"desktop-in-article-1-QI4VKYDWRGGE01"}   Audi’s deliveries in China rose 4.5% to 512,081 vehicles in the first nine months of this year, the best result in its 30-year history in the country. Audi plans to generate about 40% of its unit sales in China with electrified cars by 2025.   Published on ‎13‎ ‎October‎, ‎2020‎ ‎12‎:‎23        Have a confidential tip for our reporters?
